page.title: 19TOPICAL ARGUMENTS
page.content: In a rural area such as ours the main topics for dicussion are to do with farming.One such concern is stubble burning,the danger factor of smoke on the road and complaints about debris. Another is mud on the road. This is usually in connection with sugar beet lorries as this is harvested in the Autumn.Every year used to see more and more hegderows being pulled up and ditches filled in to make larger fields.Now farmers have realised the harm that has been done and have started tree planting and copicing hedges. Another issue is aircraft noise as there are 5 R.A.F. stations within a 20 mile radius.However the R.A.F.are aware of the nuisance value and usually put notices in the local paper to warn of low-level flying and night flying.
